spells.description:
Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.
spells.materials: bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal
spells.name: Darkness

spells.description:
You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely humanoid form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10- foot radius. 

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.
spells.materials: a bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm
spells.name: Dancing Lights

spells.description:
Each object in a 20-foot cube within range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Any creature in the area when the spell is cast is also outlined in light if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius.

Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can't benefit from being invisible.
spells.name: Faerie Fire

textBlocks.body: The drider has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drider to sleep.
textBlocks.title: Fey Ancestry

textBlocks.body:
The drider's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). The drider can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: dancing lights

1/day each: darkness, faerie fire
textBlocks.title: Innate Spellcasting

textBlocks.body: The drider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
textBlocks.title: Spider Climb

textBlocks.body: While in sunlight, the drider has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
textBlocks.title: Sunlight Sensitivity

textBlocks.body: The drider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.
textBlocks.title: Web Walker

textBlocks.body: The drider makes three attacks, either with its longsword or its longbow. It can replace one of those attacks with a bite attack.
textBlocks.title: Multiattack

textBlocks.body:
Driders that were once drow spellcasters might retain their ability to cast spells. Such driders typically have a higher spellcasting ability (15 or 16) than other driders. Further, the drider gains the Spellcasting trait. A drider that was a drow divine spellcaster, therefore, could have a Wisdom of 16 (+3) and a Spellcasting trait as follows.
   Spellcasting. The drider is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The drider has the following spells prepared from the cleric spell list:

Cantrips (at will): poison spray, thaumaturgy

1st level (4 slots): bane, detect magic, sanctuary

2nd level (3 slots): hold person, silence

3rd level (3 slots): clairvoyance, dispel magic

4th level (2 slots): divination, freedom of movement
textBlocks.title: Variant: Drider Spellcasting
